meanings.sent1: The hyperbolized story was so unbelievable that no one took it seriously.
meanings.sent2: Her hyperbolized reaction to the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The hyperbolized size of the fish she caught was as big as a whale!
meanings.sent4: His hyperbolized claims about his achievements were as tall as a skyscraper.
meanings.sent5: The hyperbolized colors of the sunset painted the sky in unreal shades.

meanings.definition: To make something seem more important or impressive than it really is
meanings.sent1: She hyperbolized her role in the project to impress her boss.
meanings.sent2: He always hyperbolized his accomplishments to gain attention.
meanings.sent3: The comedian hyperbolized his fear of spiders to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: The politician hyperbolized the benefits of the new policy to win votes.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement hyperbolized the effectiveness of the product to attract customers.
